III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation An unknown worker took in edibles and gave it to a youth on an
unknown date.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported he has been at the facility for ten months. Youth A
reported a month ago a male staff dropped a gummy/edible from
his pocket, and he picked it up and ate it. Youth A reported he
knew what the gummy was, and it looked like an edible to him.
Youth A reported he did not recall the color, shape, or how he felt
after eating the gummy. Youth A reported he does not know the
staff member’s name and did not remember what the staff looked
like. Youth A reported the staff did not give him the gummy, it fell
out of the staff’s pocket and the staff did not notice it fell out.
Youth A reported it happened in the morning on Pod A and no one
saw him pick up the gummy and eat it. Youth A did not remember
if it was a school day or weekend. Youth A did not tell anyone
about it until now. Youth A later in the interview reported he did
not see the gummy fall from a staff’s pocket; he just saw it laying
on the floor. Youth A reported he is going on a home pass for his
birthday and did not want to test positive on his drug test when he
returns for something that happened at the facility. Youth A
2

reported he has never seen staff at the facility bring in any kind of
food or edibles for the youth. This was the first time this had
occurred.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B has
been placed on Pod A for about two months. Youth B reported
staff sometimes bring in candy such as Now and Later and
Skittles for the youth. Youth B reported youth ask staff to bring in
candy and the staff are nice and will bring it in. Youth B reported
he has never seen staff bring in drugs or alcohol for youth. Youth
B reported youth have cheeked their prescribed medications and
given the medication to other youth. Youth B reported this
happened a few days ago however would not specify who or
when. Youth B reported he does not know if staff are aware of the
youth cheeking medication. Youth B has not heard any youth say
they have received anything from any staff including edibles.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 has
worked at the facility since August 2022 primarily on the second
shift from 2pm-10pm on Pod A. Staff 1 reported there is policy on
bringing items in for youth and that staff are not allowed to bring
anything in. Staff 1 has never seen staff bring in items for youth.
Staff 1 reported he heard a staff brought in a vape for a youth
however he did not have any firsthand information about this.
Staff 1 reported the teachers are the only ones allowed to bring in
candy for youth. Staff 1 reported medications are passed by the
shift supervisor or a manager. Staff 1 did not have any knowledge
of youth cheeking medication. Staff 1 reported shift supervisors
and managers have youth open their mouths and check under
their tongue during medication pass to ensure the medication was
taken.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A
reported the incident to Staff 2. Youth A told Staff 2 he was
worried that he would be drug tested after an upcoming home
pass and that it would be positive due to eating an edible at the
facility. Youth A told Staff 2 a staff member was leaving a few
weeks ago and gave an edible to multiple youth. Youth A did not
specify any of the other youth to Staff 2. Staff 2 is not aware of
any other youth reporting this occurred. Youth A told Staff 2 it was
an edible but not what type, just that it was a goodbye gift from a
staff. Youth A found out on 5/26/2023 that he would be getting a
home pass for his birthday. Youth A told Staff 2 that he did not
3

think about his home pass until after he ate the edible. Youth A
reported this to Staff 2 the end of last week. Staff 2 was not aware
of any staff bringing in candy for youth. Staff 2 reported the only
time items are brought in is for incentives for a whole group and
this must be approved through supervisors and case managers.
Staff 2 has not heard about youth cheeking medications or about
a youth having a vape.
Complainant/Director was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 6/27/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Director reported Youth A has been at the facility since September
2022 and has been placed on different pods while at the facility.
Youth A is currently on Pod A and has been on Pod A for at least
four weeks. Youth A initially reported the incident happened on
Pod A and then stated it happened on Pod E. Director reported
Youth A was drug tested and the results came back negative for
all substances. Highland Police came out and interviewed Youth
A and Youth A reported the same information to the police as he
did to the facility as Director sat in with Youth A during the police
interview. Youth A reported he was concerned he would have a
positive drug test result as he has an upcoming home pass and
did not want the drug screen to be positive for something he did
while in the facility. When Youth A was asked by police who the
staff member was, Youth A began laughing and would not provide
the staff’s name. Director reported her concern is the timeline
Youth A provided as it did not seem to match up. Director
reported there have been no concerns of Youth A being under the
influence of drugs while at the facility. Youth A reported the edible
was one gummy. Director reported there have been five staff
members that have left the facility in the timeframe of the incident.
Director reported staff are not allowed to bring candy in for youth,
only teachers can as it is used as a reward for schoolwork and is
approved by the facility principal who monitors it. Director
reported a staff did not bring a vape into the facility for a youth. A
family member brought the vape in and it was quickly caught by
staff during a family visit and the vape was taken by staff. Director
is not aware of any youth cheeking medication.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on 7/17/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 was employed at the
facility from 1/14/2023 through 5/31/2023. Staff 3 reported youth
at the facility asked him if he used edibles and if he would bring
edibles in for the youth, Staff 3 told the youth no. Staff 3 reported
he never witnessed staff bring in edibles for Youth A or any youth.
Staff 3 reported he worked primarily the overnight shift, and many
times was mandated to stay for the morning shift. Staff 3 worked
4

on Pod A the last two weeks while he worked at the facility. Staff
3 reported teachers brought food incentives in for youth as a
reward for school accomplishments and this was approved. Staff
3 reported the facility policy was staff (not teachers) are not to
bring in items for the youth. Staff 3 reported there were staff that
brought in food for the youth without permission and he also gave
youth extra food items that he received from the cafeteria that he
did not eat/drink such as sandwiches and juice. Staff 3 did bring
candy and peanuts into the facility in his pockets that he would eat
during shift and reported he did not give this to the youth. Staff 3
reported none of the candy/peanuts fell out of his pockets as he
wore cargo shorts and the pockets had zippers. Staff 3 denied
ever bringing edibles into the facility, giving Youth A an editable or
any youth. Staff 3 reported he did not notice any youth including
Youth A to be under the influence of drugs while he worked at the
facility. Staff 3 did not have any knowledge of any youth cheeking
medication and reported supervisors distributed medications and
the process includes the supervisor checking the youth’s mouth to
ensure the medication was taken. Staff 3 reported concerns of
supervisors being “corrupt”. When asked more about this, Staff 3
reported “corrupt” meant the supervisors did not support staff and
would side with youth. Staff 3 provided an example of a youth
lying to a supervisor about a situation between him and a youth,
Staff 3 started laughing when the youth was lying during their
version of the story and the supervisor told Staff 3 to leave the
room for laughing at the youth.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 7/24/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor 1 reported
supervisors pass medications to the youth at the facility.
Medication pass is completed by providing the specific youth with
the prescribed medication, having the youth drink water, check the
youths mouth, have the youth swish water in their mouth, check
the youth’s mouth again and under their tongue to ensure the
medication was taken. Supervisor 1 was not aware of any youth
cheeking medication nor did Supervisor 1 have any concerns that
youth are cheeking medication. Supervisor 1 reported not being
aware of any staff at the facility bringing in food for youth from
outside the facility. Supervisor 1 reported all staff are searched
prior to coming into the facility and their belongings are searched.
If staff bring in items to eat themselves during their shift, the items
must be kept in the staff lounge. Youth do receive candy from
teachers occasionally as a reward for schoolwork being completed
which is approved by the facility. Supervisor 1 reported no
additional concerns.
5

Supervisor 2 was interviewed via teams meeting on 7/24/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor 2 reported
supervisors pass medication to youth at the facility. Medication
pass is completed by giving youth their prescribed medication,
water, talking to the youth to allow time for the medication to begin
dissolving in the youth’s mouth if they did not swallow the
medication, have the youth open their mouth for the supervisor to
check that the medication is no longer in their mouth, cough, and
Supervisor 2 reported she specifically has the youth use their
fingers to open up their own mouth so she can see around the
gum area as well. Supervisor 2 has no knowledge nor has heard
of any concerns of youth cheeking medication. Supervisor 2
reported staff are not allowed to bring in any outside items for
youth including food or candy. Staff are searched by security prior
to entering the facility. Security checks staff’s bags and have staff
empty out their pockets. Supervisor 2 reported staff can bring in
food for themselves during shift however it must stay in the staff
lounge. Supervisor 2 reported teachers are approved to use
candy as an incentive for school. Supervisor 2 reported no
concerns and no knowledge of staff bringing items into the facility
besides a separate special investigation (SI 2023C0000575).
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• DMS University Laboratories Drug screen 7 results for
Youth A dated 6/24/2023: Youth A was negative for
cannabinoids.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Unusual Incident
Report Summary dated 6/23/2023: Youth A reported he
had ingested edibles from a staff.
• Prohibited Conduct Policy: Use or possession of illegal
drugs or reporting for work under the influence. Selling,
dispensing, or possession of illegal drugs on company
premises. Lending food to or borrowing food from clients.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Drug Testing Policy:
The facility strives to maintain a substance free
environment for all youth. Testing of illegal substances
may occur when there is justifiable reason to believe that
use has occurred.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Professional
Boundaries- Employee relationships with Youth:
Unprofessional boundaries include encouraging youth to
engage in illegal or illicit behaviors.
6

• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Administration of
Medication: Shift Supervisors and Medical staff will only
dispense medications and are to stay with the youth until
the medication has been swallowed, once swallowed check
the youth’s mouth, hands, medication cup to ensure
medication was taken.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Youth A reported first he got
the edible from seeing it fall out of a staff’s pocket and then stated
he just found it on the floor. Youth A did not identify a staff
member. Youth A’s drug test results came back negative for
marijuana and all substances.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility review the facility policy Prohibited
Conduct Policy with all staff to address staff bring in food items for
youth and/or providing youth with food that the staff did not eat
from mealtimes at the facility.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
